page.title: 08TEMPLETON CHAPEL.
page.content: Templeton United Reformed Church is 167 years old.It was rebuilt in 1839 and renewed in 1879.Gas lights were put in in 1924 costing Â£50 and electric ones in 1938 costing Â£23.15 shillings.In 1983 two stained glass windows each costing Â£2040 were installed.The Rev. Elwyn John is the present minister.There are 17 deacons and 100 members.Rev. Elwyn John is responsible for 3 chapels.He is paid Â£5000 a yearand Â£1200 expenses.He lives in the Manse in Templeton.There is one service on Sunday at either 10.30am,2.30pm or 6.30pm and there is Sunday School at 10.30am every week. Christenings,weddings and funerals are held in the chapel.Special Services include Mother's Day,Anniversaries and Harvest Festivals.The Chapel has seats for 400 people but is rarely full.
